title: The Multi-Path Maze
story: What if you have more than two options? The elif (else-if) statement lets you create multiple conditions, checking them one by one until you find a match. Perfect for complex decision-making!
instructions: Create a variable `score` with value 85. Use if-elif-else: if score >= 90 print "A grade", elif score >= 80 print "B grade", elif score >= 70 print "C grade", else print "Need improvement".

tests.expectedBehavior: Since 80 <= score < 90, should print B grade

hints.text: elif stands for 'else if'. You can chain multiple elif statements between if and else
Check conditions from highest to lowest. First check >= 90, then >= 80, then >= 70
if score >= 90: (A) elif score >= 80: (B) elif score >= 70: (C) else: (improvement)
